intro: Lisianthius grandiflorus, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Hawaii. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has palmate leaves that are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a symbol of Hawaiian culture and natural beauty.
